steps.name: No Config required
descriptions: This special board does not require any configuration as it has been specifically designed for Motor Control

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove jumper JP1.
Plug-in jumper JP5 as shown for power supply from USB connector of ST-LINK/V2.
Check that LD3 is turned ON.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in the two jumpers on CN2, to program the STM32.

steps.name: Recommendations
descriptions: Use the external Isolated ST LinkConnect using HIGH VOLTAGE Power Board.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper JP18 as shown for power supply from USB connector of ST-LINK/V2.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Solder bridges SB11, SB12 and SB16.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove the 0 Ohm resistor from R58 and solder it in R205 (Heat sink)

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove the 0 Ohm resistor from R34 and solder it in R204 (Bus voltage)
Remove the 0 Ohm resistor from R51 and solder it in R66 (Current C)

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Solder bridges SB10, SB14 and SB15.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: MicroSD Card must be removed from CN6 for Motor control application.
Camera module must be removed from CN15.

steps.name: Recommendations
descriptions: Connect the power board with the CN5 motor control connector using 32pin flat cable.
Connect an RS232 cable from the PC to the CN16 connector to establish the serial communication.
Connect the ST-LINK/V2 to the CN21 to upgrade the firmware.
Use the external Isolated ST LinkConnect using HIGH VOLTAGE Power Board.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper JP18 as shown for power supply from USB connector of ST-LINK/V2.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Solder bridges SB11, SB12 and SB16.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove the 0 Ohm resistor from R58 and solder it in R205 (Heat sink)

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove the 0 Ohm resistor from R34 and solder it in R204 (Bus voltage)
Remove the 0 Ohm resistor from R51 and solder it in R66 (Current C)

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Solder bridges SB10, SB14 and SB15.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: MicroSD Card must be removed from CN6 for Motor control application.
Camera module must be removed from CN15.

steps.name: Recommendations
descriptions: Connect the power board with the CN5 motor control connector using 32pin flat cable.
Connect an RS232 cable from the PC to the CN16 connector to establish the serial communication.
Connect the ST-LINK/V2 to the CN21 to upgrade the firmware.
Use the external Isolated ST LinkConnect using HIGH VOLTAGE Power Board.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove jumper JP1.
Plug-in jumper JP5 as shown for power supply from USB connector of ST-LINK/V2.
Check that LD3 is turned ON.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in the two jumpers on CN2, to program the STM32.

steps.name: Recommendations
descriptions: Use the external Isolated ST LinkConnect using HIGH VOLTAGE Power Board.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper JP14 as shown for power supply from USB connector of ST-LINK/V2.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper between PE15 (pin17) and PE14 (pin18).

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper JP13 as shown for enabled RS232 communication.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: MicroSD Card must be removed from CN16 for Motor control application.
OAM1 and PGM1 switch must be positioned as shown in Figure.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove even number resistors from R1 to R58 (R2, R4, R6... R56, R58 except R12 and R22) as shown in Figure.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Mount odd number resistors from R1 to R57 (R1, R3... R55, R57) except R11 which is mounted by default with a 0-ohm resistor as shown in Figure.

steps.name: Recommendations
descriptions: Connect the power board with the CN2 connector using 32pin flat cable.
Connect an RS232 cable from the PC to the CN8 connector to establish the serial communication.
Connect the ST-LINK/V2 to the CN5 to upgrade the firmware.
Use the external Isolated ST LinkConnect using HIGH VOLTAGE Power Board.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumpers J5 and J6 as shown for three shunt configuration.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove jumper J9.
Plug-in jumpers JP1 and JP2 as shown.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J1 Power supply connector.
J2 Motor connector.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumpers J5 and J6 as shown for three shunt configuration.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove resistor R181.
Remove jumper J9.
Plug-in jumpers JP1 and JP2 as shown.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J1 Power supply connector.
J16 Motor connector.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Three-shunt resistor circuits can be adopted by setting the solder bridges SW7 and SW8.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Add an appropriate bulk capacity (C1) to stabilize the bus supply voltage.
Plug-in jumpers SW1, SW2 and SW4 as shown.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J2 Motor control connector.
J3 Motor connector.
J4 VCC supply (20 VDC max).
J7 Supply connector (DC – 125V to 400 V).

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Three-shunt resistor circuits can be adopted by setting the solder bridges SW7 and SW8.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Add an appropriate bulk capacity (C1) to stabilize the bus supply voltage.
Plug-in jumpers SW1, SW2 and SW4 as shown.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J2 Motor control connector.
J3 Motor connector.
J4 VCC supply (20 VDC max).
J7 Supply connector (DC – 125V to 400 V).

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Three-shunt resistor circuits can be adopted by setting the solder bridges SW7 and SW8.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Add an appropriate bulk capacity (C1) to stabilize the bus supply voltage.
Plug-in jumpers SW1, SW2 and SW4 as shown.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J2 Motor control connector.
J3 Motor connector.
J4 VCC supply (20 VDC max).
J7 Supply connector (DC – 125V to 400 V).

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W1 in 3.3v position.
Plug-in jumper W3 in HIGH VOLTAGE position.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W5 in R_BRAKE position.
Plug-in jumper W1 in Silk screen marked position.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumpers W13 and W9 as shown for three shunt configuration.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W10 and remove jumper W14 as shown.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J1 Supply connector.
J2 Motor connector.
J3 15 V auxiliary supply connector.
J5 Motor control connector.
J6 Dissipative brake.
J8 Tachometer input connector for AC motor speed loop control.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W1 in A position for Vdd = 3.3V.
Plug-in jumper W2 in A position for software brake.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Three-shunt resistor circuits can be adopted by setting the solder bridges W9 and W10.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove jumper W3.
Plug-in jumper W15 for voltage 110Vac, Remove jumper W15 for voltage 220Vac

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug in W11, w12, w13 and w14.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J1 Supply connector.
J2 Motor control connector.
J4 Motor connector.
J5 Hall sensors / encoder input connector.
J6 Tachometer input connector for AC motor speed loop control.
J7 Dissipative brake.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W1 in A position for 3.3V supplied MCU.
Remove jumper W4.
Plug-in jumper W6 in A position.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Three-shunt resistor circuits can be adopted by setting the solder bridges W9 and W10.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J1 Supply connector.
J2 Motor connector.
J3 BEMF daughterboard connector.
J4 Motor control connector
J5 Hall sensors / encoder input connector.
J6 Dissipative brake.
J7 Tachometer input connector for AC motor speed loop control.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W1 in '<35V Only' position.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Three-shunt resistor circuits can be adopted by plug-in jumper W4 and remove jumper W5.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W6, W8, W9 and W11.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W7 and W10 as shown.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove jumper W13, W14, and W15.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J1 Auxiliary supply input connector.
J3 Power supply input connector.
J5 Three-phase output to motor connector.
J6 Tachometer input for closed-loop controlled AC motors connector.
J7 Motor connector.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W1 in 'HIGH VOLTAGE' position.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Three-shunt resistor circuits can be adopted by plug-in jumper W4 and remove jumper W5.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W6, W8, W9 and W11.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Plug-in jumper W7 and W10 as shown.

steps.name: Step
descriptions: Remove jumper W13, W14, and W15.

steps.name: Connectors
descriptions: J1 Auxiliary supply input connector.
J3 Power supply input connector.
J5 Three-phase output to motor connector.
J6 Tachometer input for closed-loop controlled AC motors connector.
J7 Motor connector.
